text: Cask (Guide Dog, Southampton) - Hazy golden in colour. Passion fruit, lychees, grapefruit and peach feature prominently in both the aroma and taste. Very refreshing.
botlle chiara velata buona Buona schiuma buona persistenza agrume limone un po speziato pompelmo poco corpo buon amaro succo ace

Thank you tderoeck! Sampled draft @ VCBF 2017. Pale citrus golden, little white head. Nose is green grass, floral, creamy grapefruit peel. Too high carbonation, bit metallic, touch empty, largely pleasant, bitter grass, citrus, nowhere near as fruity as you would expect given the ingredients, good but not top.
Hazy golden with a small white head. Slightly dusty aroma with grass, hints of citrus and slightly perfumed spice. Dry, fruity and spicy flavour. Tastes old.

Bottle from Redmonds. Aroma: pink grapefruit and orange zest. Really strong aroma, very striking. Bitter and floral taste up front, citrus acid and rind. Packed with flavour, with the slight chewiness of a wheat ale. Very impressive.
[5/11/17] Draught at Taphouse in Copenhagen. Yellow. Wheat, spiciness, citric note, grains, dry, bitterish, medium-bodied.
Tap golden colour with small White head.Aroma of orange peel and spices fruity and slight harsh malty with light nots of yeast nice overall.

Bottle at The Arcade Street Tavern, Ipswich. Pours hazy pale gold with a lasting bubbly white head. Aroma of citrus, light sherbet, camomile, hop, grapefruit and lemon peel. Moderate sweetness, medium bitterness. Light body, slight watery texture, average carbonation. Finish is dry and moderately bitter.

Gravity cask at the 2017 Cambridge Beer Festival. Golden brown, pretty much clear, with a wisp of white head. Smells gorgeous: I get tea, pine resin, biscuit spread, tropical fruits and candy sugar. Equally enticing taste: surprisingly sweet at first, but the bitterness starts to take over mid-sip. Finish is dry with cardboard and blueberry notes in the aftertaste. Really nice and an early contender for beer of the festival.
At the Taphouse, pours golden with a small head, aroma of fruits, tangerine, flavor is bitter with lemon skin, tangerine, medium bodied

Keg at Drafthouse Mark Lane. Hazy citrus and floral aroma. Opaque pale amber. The creamy white head has legs. Medium bitter with a peppery finish. Grapefruit and lemon. Restrained. Light - medium body. Slick. Soft carbonation. Long dry finish. Good stuff. Went down ASAP.
Cask at the Antelope in Surbiton. Nice dry, bitter hops, hints of orange peel, really nice balance. Im not a massive fan of wheat beer but this was really enjoyable.

0,33l bottle from Damian Bottle Shop, Bratislava, Pours light cloudy light golden liquid, big frothy white head, Aroma: wheat, lemon peel, lime, slightkly yeasty, Taste: light to medium sweet, medium bitter, medium sour, tangerine, lime, white grapes, yeasty, Palate: light body, average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, long bitter lemony aftertaste, Overall: fine, bit yeasty and harsh. enjoyed. Not my prefered style, but in general fine.
Bottle @ home. Murky golden pour with a generous head. Notes of overripe bananas, yeasty, light hoppy and soem floral notes.

Hazy yellow color with creamy white head, looks really good. Aroma is really yeast forward with some brett like character, floral notes and some citrus fruits. Taste starts slightly bitter and yeasty, floral notes, some light citrus fruit character, quite bitter on the finish with lingering grapefruit pith flavor. Light body with medium to high carbonation. Quite interesting take on a witbier but I think the yeast and hops dont mix as well as expected.
Clear yellow body with a thin white head. Aroma is citrus, coriander, pine. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Light body, soft carbonation, watery texture.
Golden with white head. Light hoppy aroma of flora. Strong refreshing taste with flora, citrus prevailing.

Bottle from Hops & Crafts Exeter,pours pale lemon/ gold in colour foamy white head,aroma citrus, lemon,bergamot,earl grey tea notes,grass & fresh bread, taste is citrus hop,lemon ,lemon rind ,flowery & perfumed notes ,fresh bread & feint orange rind,with good bitterness , very thin bodied & smooth , the finish feels watery with more lemon, bergamot & tea leaf notes, more orange notes I. The finish ,dry & bitter. Interesting

Cask at CBC,Covent Garden on 30th May 2016. Pale hazy gold with thick, almost white foam. Fruity, citrus aroma with grassy touches. Citrusy in-mouth with bitter orange peel. A bitter, peppery finish. Medium-bodied with a zingy mouthfeel. Rated as a novelty ale.
Pours a clear gold colour with a slight fluffy white head, aroma is light and hoppy with hints of wheat, the taste is medium bitterness with a dry bitter finish.

Cask conditioned at The University Club, Oxford. Hazy gold with white head. This had a fresh, hoppy, citrus character along with an underlying Banana, estery note. Full, crisp(ish) and quite refreshing. A pretty decent drop.

Tap
@ Irreale, Madrid, Spain.
A: Golden.
T: Wheat, citrusy, watery, slightly hoppy.

0,33l bottle at home from Alesbymail.co.uk. BB 27.04.2017. dark yellow hazy color, small white head. smells citric, spices, lemon grass, tobacco, nice refreshing smell. medium body, soft carbonation, rather watery mouthfeel. tastes of spices, a bit stale hoppy, quite watery, light yeasty, peppery, some citric / lemon grass notes, hints of mango. finishes quite watery and lightly bitter / dry with notes of lemon grass and some lime. okish, rather watery taste, not a big fan. as for as session beers go still OK.

Esters, yeast, fragrant, citrus fruits, lemon. Clear gold, hardly any head. Light bitter. Bitter floral hops, some sweet grain malts, yeast, wheat. Nice Wheat Ale, well-balanced. Bottle from Independent Spirit, Bath.

Appearance- clear and golden, a few bubbles rising, a small white head which disappears quickly. Aroma- creamy caramel malt, hops, juicy orange, pineapple, tropical fruit. Taste- bitter hops, juicy fruit, orange, peppery spices, creamy malt undertones. Nice and refreshing.

Bottle, enjoyed from it. Really refreshing nice brew. Lots of citrus/citrussy aromas- lemony, lemin peely, gingery. Suitably light bodied, intense flavour, light drinkable. Really nice tasty summer brew.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone

On tap at la caisse de bieres. Pours a thick white head with nice etherous vapors of white flowers, citrus and light hops. Yellow colored body. Nice bitterness in mouth with fine hops and fresh wheat.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Citrus and pine aroma. Cloudy golden. Good dry persistence on the finish. Pretty good.
Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy yellow with a really small white head. Aroma of wheat and orange. Taste is quite dry with some citrus and wheat. Too watery for my liking. Disappointed.

Aroma: kviesiitis, Dove klasiskaa dusas zeleja, nenogatavinaatas zaljaas erkskogas. Diezgan intensivs aromat, loti tiikami. Garsaa: tas pats tikai ar ruugtuminju un ellains. Bet garsas notis pazud rugtumaa, zel

On keg at Ushers. 
Appearance - hazy no cloudy golden with a decent head. 
Nose - orange and pink grapefruit. 
Taste - grapefruit and pith.
Palate - light bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry finish. 
Overall - goodness me, Id almost written off this style but that is good.
Cask at the Chesham Arms, hazy dark gold with a clinging head, aromas of sage, pineapple and melon. Dry fruitiness, dusty spice, a fascinating take on a hopped up Witbier.

Pours cloudy orange but is lacking in its head, a thin white head is there. Nice spicy orange and clove aroma. A little spiceness in the flavour, some citrus but its not very strong, quite a watery beer.

Bottle, september 26th 2015. Hazy golden body, white head. Aroma of wheat, lemon, peach and mild piney. Taste is malty with a mild fruitiness. Light peppery yeast, dry and bitter finish. Missing a little out on the wheat elements, then again Im not eally a fan of this "white ipa" thing going on.

Pours clear light golden with thin white head. Aromas of citrus, zest, light grass and spice with wheat - almost a Belgian yeast hint. Not a huge amount of carbonation and quite light mouth feel. Taste is dominated by lemon zest with a hint of soap. Nice bitter finish with touch of lemon.

Bottle. Pale golden body with white head. Aroma is citrus and fruits with some malts in the background. Taste is dry bitter citrus with hints of pale wheat malts. Aftertaste is nice dry bitter. Nice summer beer.
Floral aroma , with some Belgian yeast influence. A sweet fruit, finishing with hop bitter finish.

Bottle from Piccadilly Tap. Nice citrusy aroma, lemon and a bit of biscuit. Taste is good, citrus again, quite high hoppiness, grassy, quite dry. More malty later on. Maybe its not as fresh as it could be, but I like it.
Interesting combination of wheat beer and IPA that works very well with the fruity hop flavors against the softer body from the wheat.

Bottle 0.33l from Dranken Geers Ghent Belgium.Taste at our place in Gent Belgium.23.07.2015.Pour it hazy yellow color with medium white head.Aroma floral and lemon peel.Taste of wheat, crispy, really refreshing, some lemon, bitter grass finish.I liked it.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Göteborg. Hazy amber colour, mediumsized creamy head. Aroma is fruity, wheaty, mild floral and resiny notes along with some herbs. Flavour is wheat, wood, mild crisp maltiness to it as well as some floral and mild nectary notes. A bit grainy in the finish.

Sampled from bottle @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Clear yellow golden color, small white head. Aroma is hops, very grassy, sweet hops. Taste lightly malts, hops, sweet hops lightly, lightly bitter, pretty grassy again. Light but suitable body and carbonation.

Sample at Leuven Innovation Beer Festival. Thanks for sharing todays beers!
APPEARANCE: clear blond beer.
NOSE: bitter, fruity.
TASTE: very fruity, little bitter, nice in balance.
Draught at Black Sheep. Hazy yellow with a solid white head. Aroma of perfume. Flavor is spicy, caramel, a little fruity on a wheaty, tangy finish. Bubbly on the lips.
nice raspberry aroma, a glowing amber colour body with a creamy white head, really good raspberry and grapefruit flavour sweet refreshing finish

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ & Friends, Copenhagen (12/06/2015) - orange pour with white head. Aroma and taste is grapefruit fruity, with some peachy and citrus notes, wheaty and pine notes throughout. Nice.

15/V/15 - 33cl bottle from Tilquin English Beer Festival @ the Abeels (NL) - BB: 16/IV/16 (2015-632)  
Clear pale yellow beer, creamy irregular white head, pretty stable, bit adhesive. Aroma: very piny, resinous, grapefruit, citrus. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: very bitter, soapy, citrus, grapefruit, grassy. Aftertaste: some exotic fruits, resinous, dry, piny, citrus, soapy touch. Not bad, but not as overwhelmingly good as some of their other hoppy beers.
From tap. Hazy orange colour with a white head. Aroma and flavour of wheat, spice, fruit and hops.
Bottle at home. Hoppy, sweet, citrus aroma. Taste is the same, probably more fruity/malty than the aroma suggests. Clean finish. Good.
Pale golden beer, white head... hoppy, spicy, fruity... is as it says, a hoppy witbier... pretty nice, but nothing special.
Draught. A bit hazy golden beer with an offwhite head. Hoppy spicy grassy citrus caramell and fruity aroma. Hoppy spicy grassy citrus caramell and wheat flavour. Refreshing beer :-)

[Reading Beer Festival, 2015] - Siren Craft White Tips, 4.6%, gelbgolden leicht trüb. Kräftiges Garpefruitaroma, Hefe, etwas süßlich. Mit Pfefferkorn vergoren. Mittlerer Körper, kaum wässrig. Zunächst trocken, ganz leicht säuerlich, hefig, mit erkennbarer Pink Grapefruit Note. Auch floral, stärker noch zur Mitte. Grapefruit bleibt erhalten bis in den Nachhall, daneben v.a. Hefe. Eine leicht pfeffrige Note verrät die Pfefferkörner im Mix. Nachhall mild, flüchtig, moderat. Interessantes britisches Weizenbier mit viel Grapefruit.
On hand pump at the Bell, Waltham St Lawrence. Pale straw with a loose white head; grapefruit aroma; tart grapefruit taste, with some underlying mango; and a clean and refreshing finish. Rather good.
Fat bishops örebro. Disig gulaktig vätska med vitt skum. Fräsch och fruktig doft. Len och fin smak. Vetemalt, tropisk frukt och ljust bröd. Fin sommaröl
Hell, gelb, pilsig. In der Nase Zitrus, Abrieb, Honig. Am Gaumen Zitrusnoten, bitter, rund.

On tap at L'Express de Lyon-- Pours hazy yellow with medium white head. Nose is citrus and white flowers. Aromas are citrus, grass and piney notes. Medium carbonation, oily texture. Long bitter piney finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

15cl sample from bottle at the Leuven Innovation Beer Festival (25 V 2015). This one is an odd yet lovely brew that balances between a dry (too dry), bitter IPA start and a wheat beer finish. A very well balanced white IPA for sure: a not that bitter mouth, a lovely malty, wheat experience. A nice drink.

Bottle sample @ Leuven Beer Innovation 2015, shared with the RB Belgian crew.
Léger doré trouble, col fin blanc.
Arôme au bouquet houblonné de lIPA sur un rétro malt froment accompagné par une impression dagrumes, pamplemousse et citronné.
Palais est léger et rafraichissant pour un houblonné noble, finement épicé. Retrouve un houblonné noble et une touche fraiche de pellette. Le profil IPA reprend vite le dessus avec un côté agrumes plus plaisant, pour un fini sec. Malt pâle, froment.

ivorywhite head leaves structured lacing. golden yellow colour. aroma is lots of passionfruit, slight grassy/grainy, bit sulphury. taste like aroma, bit of wheat-like citric sourness, floral, long bitter slight wry finish. quite thin mouthfeel, medium carbonation. not picking up much "wit" tbh. bottle @ LIBF 15

330ml bottle, pours hazy orange gold, small white head. Aroma has large c hop notes, grapefruit, lemon and mango, dry spicy wheat, caramel. Light medium body, oily texture, finish is spicy and long bitter with average carbonation.
Sample @ Leuven Innovation Beer Festival 2015. Very good mix between a white beer and an IPA.-- rated with beerbasher/winphone
330 ml bottle. Pours a hazy copper color with light head. Aromas of dried fruit, pine, and light wheat. Lighter flavors of spice, spruce and dried resiny hops.
Fast klare goldene Farbe, fingerbreite weiße schaumkrone. Geruch sehr malzig, leicht grasig hopfig, bitter. Geschmack trocken hopfig, grasig bitter, citrusfrüchte, lecker
330ml bottle. Pours a hazy light yellow with thin white head. Aroma is orange peel, wheat, hops. Dry bitter hops and orange/lemon zest.earthy finish. Cloves. Nice.
Pours a slightly cloudy yellow with a white head. Plenty of wheat in the smell and quite a hoppy taste.
From the barrel at Reading Beer Festival 2015. Cloudy amber. Zesty grapefruit aroma. Dry, earthy and fruity. Has character and clearly some quality, but its not to my tastes.

Bottle bought at Tilquin. Orange, golden with a big head. Orange peel, hoppy, wheat aroma. Taste is packed with orange peel, little bit soap, hoppy, awesome. Fizzling on the tongue, truly a fantastic beer.

(Cask at Cask Pub & Kitchen, Pimlico, London, 24 Apr 2015) Golden colour with foamy, white head. Fruity, hoppy nose with notes of citrus, lemon peel, grass and hay. Fruity, malty taste with citrus, lemon, apricots, tropical fruit and a balanced grassy bitterness. Medium body, with a touch of sweetness. Tasty, with a fresh hop character and a slightly soapy wheat taste. Quite nice.

The Understudy / Southbank / Keg / £5.60. Pours clear with a decent lasting head. Its perfectly carbonated. The aroma is spicey & citrusy + notes of coriander. Taste wise wheat & citrua hops stand out. Another great beer from Siren.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ tasting room. Golden beer with small head. Aroma is wheat and citrus. Taste is citrus, sherbet, lemon and a touch wheat. Very fizzy on the palate. Very good.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Beer Central, Sheffield. Very hazy, mucky gold colour. Film of sticky, white head. Nice balance of juicy hop, and bready malts. Soft yeastiness to it. Taste is crisp bitter. Turns mineral dry. Zing on the palate. Finishes crisp, zesty bitter. Good one.

Keg at Draft House, Hammersmith, in the company of Jackie and Simon, Saturday 2nd May 2015   Hazy lemony colour with a white sticky head. Some pleasant wheat aromas, spice and then citrus, these all come through in the mouth and this is a hop forward assertive wheaty beer, but very good. A7 A4 T7 P3 Ov14 3.5

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2015 Cask at The Hanging Bat. Pours almost clear pale golden. Nose is lemon, wheat, lime, coriander, peach, pine. Nice. Taste is hoppy, grass, pepper, orange and citrus, wheat. Unfortunately not as great as the aroma.
Cask at the hanging bat. Pours hazy pale gold, thick white head. Aromas of citrus, pine. Taste is fresh orange, light bitter. Crisp finish.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines, Birmingham. Poured a hazy straw colour with a frothy white head. The aroma is yeast, grassy, pine needle hop. The flavour is moderate bitter with a big yeast, citrus, grass hop, light pepper spice, light toothpaste bitter palate. Light bodied with lively carbonation.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with JMGreenUK.
Thick creamy white head. Very hazy blond pour. Nice refreshing bitterness. Easy drinking
Bottle. Deep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is coriander, malt, orange. Flavour is coriander, malt, hop, lemon, citrus peel , spices, wheat, orange. Medium body. Nice beer. KRS 150814.
draft at Blue Monk, Buffalo NY. Nice whiteIPA, fruit forward, especialy citrus. peach,nectarine, orange. touch of coconut. decent
330ml bottle (tasting @VastActive place, thanks). Clear golden color. Small size, white head. Citrus, fruity, bubbly aroma. Sweet, citrus in taste. Medium carbonation.

Overall: Citric, grass, soap, peel.Note: Bottle 330 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2014-08-09.Earlier Rating: 8/9/2014 Total Score: 3.6Overall: Citric, grass, soap, peel.Note: Bottle 330 ml at a De Klomp tasting. Reviewed 2014-08-09.

330ml bottle - thanks VastActiv and the rest of the Hel crowd!
Swimming pool aroma. Trying to be modern and inventive, I guess, much more a citrussy hoppy beer than a wit. Whatever, I dont like many wits anyway. Desperately boring taste, wheat not getting a chance to shine. Mostly citrussy. Mutating mjs words, a confusing example of a style that bores me.

Keg at the Keanes Head, Nottingham on 14 October 2014. Hazy straw. Off white head. Quite orangey fruit. Decent tangy fruit and hops on the palate. Ive not generally been too much of a fan of these "white" IPAs but this one was fine. Not too much estery character. Maybe not one of my favourite Siren beers but pretty tasty and enjoyable.

33 cl bottle (4.5%) @ VastActiv, BBE 31.09.2014
Aroma has rather soapy citrus with apricot, some . Flavour has apricot, minerals and some fruity tones. Also some artifical plastic notes on some sips. Could not locate the wheat here, but a Belgian one this definitely is. The last sips are telling me that this is just too sweet with all that apricot.

(Bottle, 0.33 l - BB 31st Sept 2014, courtesy VastActiv, 20141122) The beer poured pale golden and clead. Its head was medium sized and white. Aroma had fruitiness, herbalness and citricness. Palate was medium bodied with medium carbonation. Flavours were ciricness, coriander, sweetness, malts and bitterness. Aftertaste was hoppy and bitter. A nice example of a style that confuses me.
UPDATED: NOV 23, 2014 Bottle 0.33l at home, Helsinki. BBE 31.09.2014. Colour is clear golden with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, citrus, some wheat and malts. Not bad.

Backlog rating. Keg at CBC Covent Garden, London. It pours a hazt pale yellow color with a medium white head. Aroma is fruity and hoppy with notes of citrus, cedar wood, grapefruit and grass. Taste is medium bitter and slightly sweet with notes of hay, grains, grass, violets, grapefruit, citrus, black pepper. Dry finish with dried grains. Light bodied with lively carbonation. Overall, easy drinking and very tasty

Bottle shared with Simonsen
Orange, very hazed, big creamy white head. Smell of citrus peel, spices, citrus hops and a touch of funk. Moderate sweet, fruity, spicy, some orange peel. Ends off with moderate bitter tail. Quite nice

Slightly hazy, warm golden colour, white head. Aroma of hops, wheat, citrus, tropical fruits, citrus peel, orange and lemongrass. Light sweet, light bitter flavour, quite fruity, grapefruit and apricot, hint of coriander seeds. Finish citrus peel, wheat and lemongrass. Rather nice!
(From 33cL bottle @ Diester Bierfestival, Diest 2014. As White IPA. Thanks for sharing, Emiel1001!)

Served way too cold Small off-white head over fully hazy orange beer with a pinkish sheen. Very fruity nose, citrus and exotic fruit, faintly spiced, and lots of rosewater/amandine. Sweetish-aromatic, but with a marked, pleasing bitter surrounding. Fruit, bitter fruit, and even a tad wry. Excellent balance, spices not imposing. Very spritzy feel, refreshing. Light body, wheatslickness. Usually Im not overfond of this kind of mix-of-doubtful-styles. This one might well figure as the exception confirming the rule...

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ - hazy orange beer with a long lasting white foam; pretty shy aroma of coriander and bubblegum yellow fruits; moderate malt body;quite highly carbonated; pretty dry and bitter, fruity and spicy finish - very unspectacular
Bottle shared with Mr_H a deep golden amber ale aroma is sweet and fruity flavour is grapefruit slight wooden notes with a herbalflavours also present
330ml bottle from Drygate, Glasgow (as Siren White IPA, 4.5% abv on the bottle label) - clear golden, thin white head, fruity, aromatic aroma, no lacing, aromatic, sherbet flavour, high carbonation

(bottle, 33cl, as White IPA) Hazy, golden colour with a medium-sized and slightly off-white foamy head. Fruity hoppy aroma with notes of citrus, grapefruit, tangerine, as well as slightly resiny and sweaty notes. Bitter and slightly sweet flavour, light bodied with a spritzy carbonation. Yeasty, moderately wheaty taste with citrus-fruity and zesty hops, mildly spicy notes in the background; dry-ish bitter and delicately sweet finish with a good dash of fruity and slightly resiny aroma hops. Pleasant. 22.IX.14

330ml bottle from Ales By Mail


Aroma and flavour of citrus some spices too. OK.

Bottle, best before 2014-09-31. Hazy orange with a medium sized good lasting and lacing white head. Citrusy nose. Flavour also has lots of citrus, bubblegum, flowers, coriander, white pepper, dusty grain, some light tropical fruits also. Filling and fluffy, light bitterness, light dry finish. Really refreshing and easy to drink.

Fruity aroma with hints of citrus. The taste is slightly fruity and sour. Wonderful bitterness that fills the mouth a long time. The more you drink the beer so it becomes better. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.
Excellent wheat ale, so hoppy and tasty. Excellent body and well ballanced.

Fermentoren, Aarhus, DK.
Tap, 0714.
Yellow with White head. Aroma of spices and wheat. Flavor with yeast, fruit and wheat

Bottle at home in London - shared with Lyoli. Pours unclear gold with a frothy white head. The nose has lots of zesty citrus, lemon peel, some spruce, pale wood, dry wheat and spicy pine. Light to medium sweet flavor with notes of pine and spruce, some Belgian yeast, lightly sugary wheat, bubblegum, coriander, lemon peel. Light to medium bodied with average, spritzy carbonation. Finishes with refreshingly spicy pine, pine needles, mild cedar, spruce, pale wood, more zesty lemon, subtle bitter citrus rind. Lingering spicy pine in the aftertaste. Quite a novel beer. Its a bit wacky at first but I enjoy it more and more as I drink it. Nice work.

Bottle at home from ales by mailslightly hazy pale amber with frothy offwhite head. Fruity tangerine and slightly soapy nose. Full bodied, fruity, citrus peel pithy bitterness, earthy slightly faecal Brett and yeast esters, moderate carbonation. Dry citrussy finish.

Really fresh citrus lead. A little sour. Like a brett-influenced IPA (without overbearing funk). Unfortunately that juicy allusion is an illusion. The flavor is much more subdued some wheat-ale characteristics. Spiky saison yeast flavor and a hint of citrus peel. Intentionally light but unfortunately a little chalky and watery. Light and short prickly bitterness in the finish. Generally wheat ales are insipid, bland entities. This isnt. An unconventional wheat-ale (Im not utterly convinced it conforms) but as a Ratebeer wheat ale its the best Ive had.
Some light citrus peel in this but wheat makes for a light backbone. A good session beer here. Pours golden with food head and lacing. Tap at Churchkey.
Let og frisk øl med klare citrus og frugt noter, hvor witt sødmen ikke tager overhånd [APK: 3.71]
On tap at OConnors. Cloudy yellow with big white head. Aroma of lemon blood grape, orange, zest, wheat and sweet malt. Taste is very zesty, wheat loads of citrus and peel. A bit heavy on the citrus
Bottle. Poured opaque yellow with a white head. Good aromas of orange, spice, lemongrass and coriander. Tasted sweet bitter and hoppy. Good.

Bottle. Orange, hazy body, with a big, frothy, white head. Aroma of citrus, orange, passion fruit, berries, flowers, some spices. Tastes of citrus, passion fruit, berries, spices, yeast, wheat, grass. Mouthfeel is light, slick, with a low carbonation and it finishes medium bitter, spicy, citric and slightly acidic. Overall a refreshing and easy to drink ale with lovely, fruity aromas. The low ABV makes this a very sessionable summer beer. I think this is a perfect hybrid of a Wit and a Session IPA. Enjoyable!

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours hazy deep golden with a off-white head. Aroma has notes of malt, white, orange, lemongrass and coriander. Taste is medium sweet and medium bitter with a long spicy, wheat and orange finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, as White IPA. It pours a dense, white head of finger-thick height. Nice curtains. Unclear, dark golden body. The aroma has lemongrass, coriander and quite a lot of orange peel. Some pale malts. Some sweetness in the flavor, with a decent bitterness. Pale malts, orange and coriander. Medium body and soft carbonation. Lasting finish with a pleasant carbonation. Quite nice this one, easy drinkable, and perhaps a tad sweet. 140815

Bottle. Pours cloudy golden with a white head. Aroma of orange peel, citrus, some peppery notes,malt and floral notes. Flavor is sweet and fruity with some spices, yeast and orange. Medium body, average carbonation.

33 cl bottle.
Pours pale golden color with a large white head. Grapefruits and spices on the nose, floral hops, grass and faint lemon also. Lemon, grapefruits and hay on the flavor, subtle hops, yeast and faint wheat. Mildly sourish palate with a bitter finish. Nice and refreshing.
3424

Draft at Edmunds Oast. Hazy light golden pour with a fluffy white head. Zesty citrus hop aroma, Belgian yeast, dank and fairly spicy. Flavor is similar that is crisp and refreshing. One of the better Belgian Wits Ive had.
Fresh, citric aroma and taste. Clouded, murky appearance. Suitable for hot days and light food.
Keg @ Port Street Beer House. Slightly hazed golden ale with a thin bubbly head. Has a slightly dry fruit hop aroma with a more crisp fruitiness in its taste.

Bottle. Hazy gold with a large white foam. Aromas are wheat with mixed spices, ginger and vanilla. Citrus rind with creamy oak barrel and light pine. Flavours are sweet tropical fruit with green pine and dry woodiness.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */: Sweet hoppy clear golden. Wheat IPA without the big wheat flavor.
Tap @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours hazy pale golden with a white head. Buttery aroma. Århus takes out Odense. What a trademark. Underneath spices, yeast and citrussy hops. Hmmhh..

Draught @ Taphouse, Lavendelstraede 15, DK-1462 Copenhagen, Denmark. [ As Siren White Tips ].Clear medium orange yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, moderate hoppy, citrus, moderate yeasty, spicy. Flavour is moderate sweet and light moderate bitter with a average to long duration, wheat, yeasty, spicy notes. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is soft. [20140521]

UPDATED: JUL 24, 2014 Tap. Pours hazy orange, big two finger off-white head. Aroma is pine, wheat, fresh sweet tropical fruits. Taste is light sweet, clean wheat and citrusy and medium body with fizzy feel. Finish is oily and then some coriander with the bitterness.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2015 Cloudy straw coloured with a sweet citrus, malty, herbal and spicy toffee flavour, orange and tropical notes on the creamy finish. Fantastic for a relatively low ABV!
Flaske medbrakt av Carsten. Gylden farge. Moderat karbonert. Smaker sitrus, furunål, frukt.krydder.

Keg at Brewdog Edinburgh. 
Small white head stays well, nice lacing. Hazy pale golden body. Nose of tropical fruit, pineapple, mango. Fruit salad sweets. Flavour is citrus, light grass and straw, soapy aftertaste. Medium carbonation, good fizz on the tongue. Decent wit.

Bottled. Pours hazy golden with small white head. Aroma of wheat, yeast, hint of citrus and spicy notes. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry and nice bitter. Medium bodied, oily to watery texture and soft carb. A nice hoppy Wheat.

330ml bottle. Cloudy, orangey golden colour with average to huge, thick, frothy to creamy, fairly lasting, moderately lacing, white head. Citrusy, hoppy aroma, notes of grapefruit, a touch of passion fruit and mango, sweet-ish malty background, a yeasty, spicy touch. Taste is slightly funky yeasty, bitter and citrusy hoppy, hints of grapefruit and lemon, a touch of orange zest, malty basis with subtle sweetness; lasting bitter hoppy and minimally chalky finish.

UPDATED: JUN 5, 2015 Bottle at home. Pours golden, nose has light spices and peach, taste is floral, sweet, citrus, juicy. 3.7

Cask at the hanging bat, blind tasting.  Pours clear golden, nose is fruity, toffee, pine, taste is dry, sweet pine. 3.5

0,33 l bottle 
amber, cloudy, frothy, white foam, cereal, citrus, herbs, spruce, light sweetness, very bitter, medium body, oily feel, average carbonation,

330 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy yellow colour with a white foamy head. Aroma of floral hops, citrus, coriander and some pepper. Flavour of crisp bitterness, some sweetness, herbs, spiciness and biscuity malts. Medium bodied and smooth mouthfeel. Clean and fresh. Enjoyable.

On tap, at The Local Pub in Athens. Hazy golden pour, with a good white head. Aroma of grasses, citrus, fruits, pine, malt and florals, with a taste to match. Perfectly placed in the sweet spot (or, more accuratelt, the dry, bitter, balanced spot) between an IPA and a Wit. Best of both worlds, and another Siren triumph. My go-to session beer in this World Cup summer of long hot football nights: refreshing and low enough abv for me to last right though to the penalties.

330ml bottle from Ales by Mail
BBE 31st September 2014 - Pours clear golden yellow with a smooth head. Aroma of crisp malts, stingy citrus, lemon peel, orange, fruits, wet hops and spices. Taste is yeasty, fruity, citrusy and hoppy with some lemon, spices and wheat. Finish is crisp hoppy, slightly yeasty and lemony with loads of citrus, fruits, some spices and slight tartness. Quite refreshing, excellent summer drink.
Floral aroma, some bread, some citrus. Spicy wheat flavor with a kick of hops. Nice hoppy floral aftertaste, long lasting. Medium to thin body.

On tap at The Local Pub, Athens Greece. Golden orange color, off white frothy head. Aromas of everything that can be found in nature. Fruits, flowers, citrus. Everything. The taste following perfectly the nose. Damn good. Bittersweet aftertaste. Medium body with low to medium carbonation.

Bottle from Tomlinsons beer shop. Pours hazy amber, pure white head with solid lace up glass. Punchy pine and grapefruit tropical fruits. Spicey fresh wheat full mouth feel. Slight dry finish. Solid wheat IPA.
Siren is producing some of the most flavourful beers in the UK. Keep it up.

Bottle from Beermerchants. Pours light hazed golden with a big creamy white head. Aroma is sweet malty, some good citrussy hops. Taste is moderate sweet, malty with a well balanced bitterness, citrus and yeast, lingering dry finish, good.
Draught @ Älgen. Heavy citrus notes. Cookie like sweetness. Sme grape in the aftertaste. A bit sour aswell. Smooth and drinkable.
From tap. Color yellow with a small white head. Aroma pine, grapefruit, hop, citrus, fruits. Taste fruits, spicy, hoppy. Refreshing.

Draught at The Flying Elk.
Pours yellowish amber with a white head.
A bit heavier than I expected, malty with some modern hops. Lacks the belgo qualities.
Bottle from Cotteridge Wines. Pours hazy amber. Love Siren. Best UK brewery? This is beautiful tropics, mixed with feint chalk and floral herby wheat. Great thick mix.
Bottle from Vesuvio, Darlington. A cloudy blond with a white head. Really hoppy with grass and pine notes. a little lightweight, but otherwise good.
Draught at Ølbaren. Cloudy yellow - white head. Citrus. Orange. Zesty. Ok light bitterness. Nice fruity. Peppery. Wheaty. Ok bitterness. Nice bitter/fruity/spicy mix.

Tap @ Fermentoren Aarhus. Hazy yellow, medium white head, nice lacing. Aroma, malty, wheat, hops, citrus, fruity. Similar taste. Nice and drinkable. Slightly oily mouth feel. Low to medium carbonation. Light bitterness. Bitter aftertaste, with wheat and pine notes.
Tap Fermentoren Aarhus. Amber color with medium off-withe head. Aroma is yeast, grapefruit and mango. Taste is yeast, mango, orange and some spices.

Draught @ Fermentoren, Århus. Pours slightly hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma of light wheat, fruity hops, peach, pineapple, citrus. Flavor is wheat, sweet fruity hops, peach, white grapes, citrus. Medium body, average carbonation, light bitter finish. Nice and easy beer to drink. 250614

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty and moderate hoppy - fruity and citrus. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish. 260614
Tap @ Fermentoren, Århus. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, citrus, grass, malt, flowers and lots of hops. Nice.

Tap @ Fermentoren, Aarhus. Hazy dark yellow with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, wheat, yeast, little spices and hop. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, wheat, yeast, little sweet, little dry, spices and bitter.

Draught. Creamy White good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Heavy hoppy and moderate malty aroma. Heavy bitter wonderfull flavor. Citrus and flowers. Wheat almost not present. Long great finish. Creamy palate. Excellent.

Cask at CBC, Brixton 21/06/14. Pours a slightly hazy amber/gold with a white head. Aroma is zesty with some mango and trop fruit.Light to medium body, mild carbonation. Lemon, orange, brown toast, light woody resin, pine... Tasty.
Cask at Euston Tap. Hoppy taste, not so strong, but moderate. I enjoy mild flavour of witbier.

Fra fad, Lidkoeb, københavn. Uklar gylden, med et stort frodigt, knitrende hvidt skum. Mere IPA end belgisk wit, men har en dejlig blød karakter. Dufter humlet og frisk af lime, grapefrugt og gran-nåle. Tør og mediumbitter.

As always from Siren this is good. Lots of citrus hitting the shared note between a wit and an IPA. Ive never been a huge fan of wheat beers but theres enough hops in here to keep me happy and its quite smooth.
Keg at Pelt Trader, Cannon Street, London. A hazy golden coloured pour with a medium white head on top. Lemon, wheaty aroma. Tastes similar, lemon, wheaty, spice, slightly hoppy too. Nice effort.

330ml bottle. Peachy amber opaque with murk as you tilt the bits in. Loose White foam. Nose contains orange barley squash, kumquat and mango. Fine soapy perfumed hop with lavender and mango; slick moussed mouthfeel, kumquat and sherbet. Mellow balanced hop stewed effort. Good crisp hop punch.

Cask conditioned	handpump	Craft Beer Co WC1	London	27/05/14. A golden coloured beer with a bright white head and lace. A nice beer. Good hops but the wheat gives it a mellow effect. Hints of tropical fruits. Nicely balanced. Like this.

29th May 2014Hazy gold beer, tidy off white head. Palate is light and a little airy, fine crispness. Really nice lemon sherbet with a touch of candy fruits. Little orange citrus. Light finish. Just a lovely sherbet dib dab of a beer!
Draught at Brewers Beer Bar, Göteborg, Sweden. Hazy golden, medium white head. Slightly spicy aroma, piney and citric hops. Light to medium bodied, medium carbonation. Dry with medium bitterness

Cask at CBC Covent Garden. Clear pale amber orange, still, big foamy white head. Aroma of lemon, estery wheat. Body is medium, low carbonation. Taste is bubblegum, orange, lemon, soft bitterness. Strong fruity character. Very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 6, 2015 A lot of hop taste, just pure pellets, I guess its a bit grassy with some bitter touch to it, very clean body, but not balanced and not in harmony, a gimmick more than a beer to me.

330ml bottle from Cotteridge Wines, thanks to Simon & also keg @ Earl of Essex, thanks to me. Lovely fresh citrus aroma, bright icy hop, spice and pith in the taste with a touch of lemon sherbert and lime juice. Very refreshing.
Nose is alcohol whiff, sweet orange juice, later cookie dough, feel is quite broad, taste is bittersweet orange juice, lime, leaves, damp clothes, mediumdry balanced hops finish
Pours hazy yellow with low white head. Aroma of wheat, passion fruit, citrus, honey. Taste is fruit and wheat sweet with loads of honey in the finish. Body is light and smooth with soft carbonation.

Poura hazy pale yellow with a low white head. Aromas of lemongrass, peach, citrus, mango. Taste is peach, citrus, lemongrass, passion fruit. Mourhfeel is medium body with medium carbonation. Aftertaste is peach, lemongrass and citrus.

Draught at The Rover, Göteborg. Somewhat hazy golden beer with a decent offwhite head. Hoppy wheat aroma, spicy, grassy, citrus, caramel, oranges, cream notes. Hoppy wheat and spice flavor, grassy, citrus, floral notes, lemongrass, some hay. Decent beer that is kinda refreshing.

Bottle from The Bottle Shop Canterbury and drunk at home. Hazy dirty amber colour thick lasting ivory head. Tangerine grapefruit aroma with some yeasty esters. Spice is there too. Quite a smooth slightly sweet seeming beer. The spice comes through more as you drink it. Orange peel flavour is pleasant. Always a spice/hop edge to the beer. Perhaps a touch too much spice for me, but tasty enough. Some sherbert.
330ml bottle from Grumpy Goat, Reading. Cloudy golden yellow coloured with a lasting thin white head. Aroma peachs and cream. Flavour is crisp, dry, some tropical fruits, and citrus hoppy finish.

Hazy, golden yellow, minimal white head, foam, aromatic, citrus, smooth, low to medium bitterness, quite refreshing, not overpowered by spices, very drinkable, nice mouth feel but mine was more shaken than the average beer due to transportation, Bottle at the bottle shop.

Draft. A hazy yellow beer with a lazing white head. The aroma has notes of lemons, oranges, spicy hops, and a bit of malt. The flavor is sweet with notes lemons, straw, and spicy hops, leading to a bitter finish.

Tap @ Fermentoren,Cph. Pours murky pale yellow with a small, staying, creamy white head. Aroma has wheat, orange zest, citrus, apple peel. Medium to low carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel for the ABV. Flavour has good exotic fruits, resin, peach, pineapple. Solid bitterness with some grainy wheat notes. Nice and fresh.
From tap. Pours cloudy orange with a small white head. Pine and grapefruity hoppy. Smooth fruity, peachy and citrusy. Dry and bitter lingering finish. Smooth fruity.

Bottle from Cotteridge Wines; hazy amber pour with a big fluffy white head, amazing aroma that leapt from the bottle at pour big zesty citrus, taste is spicy cardamom with fresh citrus, excellent drop.

Cask at CBC Cov G, 09/05/14.
Clear golden with a decent off white head that retains well.
Nose i juicy hops, light floral, tangerine, touch of spice, candied orange, peach.
Taste comprises mango, light perfumed tones, soft bread dough, tangerine, hint of pineapple, grassy, light spice.
Medium bodied, soft carbonation, hop bitterness in the close.
Way more IPA than Belgian Wit - a solid session IPA with a Belgian slant.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text:
Draught at Söder om Småland.
Clear golden colored with a small white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, pine needles and dill.
Fruity flavor of hops, citrus and pine needles with notes of dill.
Hoppy finish.

Keg at The Hanging Bat. Hazy golden body with a thick white head. No visible carbonation. Light lacing. Aroma of salt, sugar, banana and pineapple. Flavour of tangy yeast and citrus. Medium body with an oily texture. Nice fizz. Delicious.

UPDATED: AUG 3, 2015 Keg at the hanging bat... Hazy golden amber... Big white head dry zezty floral orange nose... Too bloody cold... Little fizzy... Sift dry zezty peach orange... Nice but ruined ny cold fizz 3.6 
Cask at the Hanging bat blind tastig .. ligth amber ... small white head ... soft passion fruit nose ... soft floral fruit nose ... dry passion fruit ... light orange passion fruit ... dry zesty fruits ... zety and juicy3.8

Keg at Brewdog Camden Siren tap takeover. Hazed golden yellow coloured pour with a lasting thin white head. Some lace. Aroma is nice peach Melba, orange tangerine fruits, light funk pineapple. Some carbonation on the nose as well. Flavour is crisp, dry, some tropical fruits, and citrus hoppy finish. Light straw eathyness on the flavour as well. Palate is medium dry, finish is fairly dry and some chalky carbonation on the tongue. Solid citrus clean bitterness lingers. Good drinking beer.

Draft @ Söder om Småland, Malmö. Pours a slightly hazy golden color with a small white head. Has a fruity fresh hoppy citrus aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty citrus hoppy bitter finish.

Cask in CBC Clapham. Clear golden amber, medium very very soft, creamy and fluffy brilliant white head. Nose is citrus, grapefruit, biscuit and grainy malt, little bready, minerally. Taste is pithy citrous fruit, grapefruit peel, orange, lime. Its quite sticky and sweet, fairly light carbonation.

Bottle at home and on tap at brewery, 4.5%. There is lots going on in this beer, which is way weaker than I would normally drink. Lots of citrus on the nose, some spice, very good aromatic flavour, citrus, grapefruit and spice. Excellent, better from bottle than keg

Cask @ CBC CG. Deep gold with a small head. Bright citrus and dank pine cone on the nose. Mellow smoked tea, wood. Sticky orange peel, limoncello. Citrus hoppy bitterness on the finish. Medium body, soft carbonation. Pleasing stuff.

Cask at Craft Covent Garden. It pours clear golden with a small white head. The nose is wheat, floral, lime peel, key lime pie and dough. The taste is bitter, earthy, wheat, lime, orange peel, resin, pine needles, slightly oily, peppery and a touch of alcohol with a bitter finish. Medium body and fine carbonation. Tastes higher abv than it is meant to be. Nice though.
